messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: On December 16, DET. M. R. Alton visited the Parkview Apartments in response to a reported break-in. Witnesses at the scene included Mr. Green, the building's janitor, and Ms. Jenkins, a resident of the fifth floor.FORWARD COPY TO:DETECTIVE DIVISIONCONTINUED.INFORMANT DOCS.Lt. K. L. Browning - OPERATIONSDet. Alton, Sr .. INVESTIGATIONSPARKER 18:02 BurglaryMr. Patrick, who lives next to the burglarized apartment, mentioned seeing an unfamiliar van near the building's entrance earlier that day. Mrs. Thompson, another resident, claimed she heard noises around 2 AM but dismissed it as city sounds. Arm. Technician John was on duty for the Crime Lab that night.CONTINUEDFORWARD TO:DETECTIVE DIVISION3- STATUS [CHECK ONE]Det. Alton SrOPERATIONSLt. BrowningINFORMANTThompson, Clara145 Oak Street, Rivertown, New Jersey119-398. 90415.PARKER 18:02 BurglaryAround 3:45 PM, Detective Alton and Lieutenant Browning, from the Rivertown Police Department, consulted on the gathered evidence. Captain V. R. Daniels provided additional resources for the investigation.TRAFFIC NOTICE - INVESTIGATION ONGOINGPARKER 18:02 BurglaryMrs. Thompson, in her subsequent interview, gave more details about the unfamiliar van she noticed. Sergeant T. L. Ashton will be checking nearby CCTV cameras for potential footage of the van.By 4:30 PM, Detective Alton and Lieutenant Browning convened at the Rivertown Police Department, 400 Pine Avenue, Rivertown, New Jersey. The collected evidence, including a set of unidentified footprints and some tools, was handed over for further analysis.FORWARD TO:DETECTIVE DIVISION3- STATUS [CHECK ONE]Det. Alton SrLt. BrowningAFFIDAVIT - Search or SeizureCrime Scene PhotosWitness StatementsF.I.R.Evidence Collection FormCoroner's Report(6) Other DetailsLINE UP INFOASSISTANT CHIEFDEPUTY IN CHARGER. ClarkR.P.D. 3.25P15 0578Green, JOHNNAME:ADDRESS:TELEPHONE: 45-8812DETECTIVE: M. ALTONITEM: 15-4090- 80CRIME: 18:02IDENTIFICATION NUMBER (PLEASE INDICATE WHETHER POSSIBLE OR POSITIVE)80367 - CONFIRMEDJane Smith DATE 5/05/22FORWARD TO:DETECTIVE DIVISIONCONTINUED.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: DET. M. R. Alton  Officer Context: On December 16, DET. M. R. Alton visited the Parkview Apartments in response to a reported break-in. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Lt. K. L. Browning  Officer Context: Lt. K. L. Browning - OPERATIONS Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Technician John  Officer Context: Arm. Technician John was on duty for the Crime Lab that night. Officer Role: Technician Officer Name: Detective Alton  Officer Context: Around 3:45 PM, Detective Alton and Lieutenant Browning, from the Rivertown Police Department, consulted on the gathered evidence. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Captain V. R. Daniels  Officer Context: Captain V. R. Daniels provided additional resources for the investigation. Officer Role: Captain Officer Name: Sergeant T. L. Ashton  Officer Context: Sergeant T. L. Ashton will be checking nearby CCTV cameras for potential footage of the van. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Lieutenant Browning  Officer Context: By 4:30 PM, Detective Alton and Lieutenant Browning convened at the Rivertown Police Department, 400 Pine Avenue, Rivertown, New Jersey.
